Name: Linear Programming
Description: Objective function and constraints are all linear. The most fundamental and widely applied type.

Name: Mixed-Integer Linear Programming
Description: An LP where some decision variables are required to be integers.
Solvability: NP-Hard. Solution time grows exponentially with number of integer variables.

Name: Convex Optimization
Solvability: and feasible set is a convex set.
Appearances: Portfolio Optimization (minimize risk for given return).

Name: Quadratic Programming
Solvability: and constraints are linear. A subclass of convex optimization.
Example: Efficiently solvable if the QP is convex.

Name: Nonlinear Programming
Description: Objective function or constraints are nonlinear.
Solvability: Generally difficult (NP-Hard). Solvability depends heavily on problem structure.

Name: Constraint Programming
Description: Focuses on satisfying a set of constraints on discrete variables. Good for feasibility problems.
Solvability: NP-Complete. Relies on powerful propagation and search techniques.

Name: Stochastic Programming
Description: Optimization under uncertainty. Parameters are known only by their probability distributions.
Solvability: Computationally challenging. Often requires sampling or decomposition.

Name: Robust Optimization
Description: Seeks solutions that are immune to data uncertainty within a predefined uncertainty set.
column8: Portfolio optimization that protects against worst-case scenarios.

Name: Dynamic Programming
Description: Problem is broken down into simpler subproblems. Solutions to subproblems are stored and reused.
Solvability: Curse of dimensionality. Efficient for problems with optimal substructure.

Name: Multi-Objective Optimization
Appearances: No single optimal solution. Yields a set of Pareto-optimal solutions.
column8: Designing a car to be both fast and fuel-efficient.
